text: was an old province of Japan in the area of Kōchi Prefecture on the island of Shikoku.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Tosa" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 988. It was sometimes called . The province had borders with Iyo and Awa Provinces. The ancient capital city of the province was near modern Nankoku. ==History== In the Meiji period, the provinces of Japan were converted into prefectures. The maps of Japan and Tosa Province were reformed in the 1870s.Nussbaum, "Provinces and prefectures" at p. 780. ==Geography== Tosa faced the Pacific Ocean. ==Shrines and Temples== Tosa jinja was the chief Shinto shrine (ichinomiya) of Tosa. "Nationwide List of Ichinomiya," p. 3 ; retrieved 2012-1-17. ==Related pages== * Provinces of Japan * Prefectures of Japan * List of regions of Japan * List of islands of Japan ==References== ==Other websites == * Murdoch's map of provinces, 1903 Category:Former provinces of Japan Category:Kōchi Prefecture
title: Tosa Province
